children.name: img_col
children.label: What side do you want the image on?

children.name: col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement:
children.help_text: The grid is based on 12 columns.  The numbers in each choice represents the ratio of the grid that column will take up.  Give it a try. You'll see what I mean.

children.name: text
children.label: Rich Text Editor:
children.default:
Add a Headline

Lorem ipsum dolor amet lumbersexual pitchfork dreamcatcher bitters cloud bread. Man bun beard pok pok pickled cliche palo santo raw denim paleo bespoke typewriter asymmetrical chillwave activated charcoal.

children.name: image
children.label: Upload Your Image:
children.help_text: IMPORTANT:  Be mindful of the image size. If you upload a high-rez image you with a big file size it will slow down the site speed.  For this image, you generally don't want anything wider than 1200px.

children.name: img_size_fluid
children.label: Make Image Size Fluid:
children.help_text: By having this turned on, the image will automatically size proportional to the width of the column.  By having this turned off you can control the size of the image with the settings below it.

children.name: img_first_mobile
children.label: Show Image First on Mobile & Tablet:
children.help_text: Toggling this on will show the image on top of the content when viewed on a device where the content is stacked.

children.name: text_first_mobile
children.label: Show Text First on Mobile & Tablet:
children.help_text: Toggling this on will show the text on top of the content when viewed on a device where the content is stacked.

children.name: custom_divider_color
children.label: Custom Divider Color:
children.help_text: Flip this on if you'd like to use a different color divider than you've set as the global default.

children.name: divider_color
children.label: Divider Color:
children.help_text: Set the color of the divider that sits above the content.

children.name: text_pt
children.label: Space Above Text (Padding-Top):
children.help_text: Use this to add spacing above the content. When viewing on mobile devices this will default to 0 so that you don't have any awkward spacing.

children.name: vert_align_center
children.label: Vertical Align Content to the Center:
children.help_text: This feature is awesome when the column to the right or left is much longer and you want this one to be centered vertically in this column.
children.inline_help_text: Align this column's content so it's centered with the column next to it.

children.name: advanced
children.label: //// Extra Design Elements (The geeky stuff)
children.help_text: If you fancy design trends, then this section is for you.

children.name: layer_img
children.label: Layer Headline on Top of Image

children.name: header_cutout
children.label: Text Cutout Image:
children.help_text: This is going to set the background color of the header text to the same color you have set for the row. This will give the illusion that the photo has a cutout where the text overlaps. Cool, huh?

children.name: cutout_size
children.label: Cutout Size:
children.help_text: This is going to set a consistent padding around the headline.

children.name: underlay_type
children.label: Add an Underlay?
children.help_text: This will give you the option to add a bit of pizzazz underneath the image by adding an underlay of a solid color, gradient, or another image.

children.name: shadow_size
children.label: Shadow Size:
children.help_text: This option will work the best when you have a square image that you want to give a little extra piazza too. By default this will be subtle, but with this slider you can select the size you'd like.

children.name: img_scale_position
children.label: Activate Scale & Position Settings
children.inline_help_text: This gives you the ability to scale and shift the position of the image to create some cool looks.

children.name: scale
children.label: Image Scale
children.inline_help_text: Use this sparingly. 0.1 can go a long way.

children.name: shift_left
children.label: Shift Left
children.inline_help_text: Check this to shift the image left.

children.name: shift_up
children.label: Shift Up
children.inline_help_text: Check this to shift the image up.

children.inline_help_text: Check this to shift the image left.

children.name: shift_up

children.inline_help_text: Check this to shift the image up.

children.label: Image Scale
children.inline_help_text: Use this sparingly. 0.1 can go a long way.

children.name: test
children.label: Test:
children.inline_help_text: This is currently a test. Please disregard.

children.name: bg_color
children.label: Background Color
children.help_text: Select the background color of this row.

children.name: shadow
children.label: Do you want a subtle shadow?

children.name: add_wave_top
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Top)
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the top of this row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color
children.help_text: If the row above has a white background you'll want to set the color of the way to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row above.

children.name: add_wave_btm
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Bottom)
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the base of this row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color
children.help_text: If the row above has a white background you'll want to set the color of the way to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row below.

children.name: vis_desktop
children.label: Desktop:
children.help_text: By turning this off, the row will not be visible on desktop or devices with a larger screen real-estate.

children.name: section_id
children.label: CSS ID:
children.help_text: This is great when you want to create anchor links that zips someone to a certain section of the page.  There must be no spaces in the ID you choose. Use a dash (-) or underscore (_) instead.

children.name: section_css
children.label: CSS Class:
children.help_text: This is helpful if you know just enough of CSS to be dangerous.  Make sure that class names don't have spaces.
